thread.title: David Beckham and all three sons together for EFL Cup win | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: David Beckham and all three sons together for EFL Cup win | Daily Mail Online

author: Naomi Ackerman For Mailonline
title: David Beckham and all three sons together for EFL Cup win | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The moment Ibrahimovic scored the first goal of his set piece saw David jump from his seat in delight, closely followed by Cruz who applauded, grinning. The former England winger never stopped his allegiance to the team to which he gave everything for over a decade. In a Desert Island Discs interview earlier this year, the star revealed that despite a very public rift with Sir Alex Ferguson, he credits the manager with supporting him at a crucial developmental stage of his life as a footballer. Winners: The football legend posted a picture of the pitch and crowded stands after the win to Instagram, with the caption: 'CHAMPIONS ... Congratulations to Jose , Ibra and the boys' The football legend posted a picture of the pitch and crowded stands after the win to Instagram, with the caption: 'CHAMPIONS ... Congratulations to Jose , Ibra and the boys.' He might have been worried, as Manchester United left it late to clinch a win as they beat Southampton 3-2. Jesse Lingard netted in-between a Zlatan Ibrahimovic double as Manolo Gabbiadini's brace was ultimately left in vain. Ecstatic: David Beckham (centre) and sons Brooklyn (right), Romeo (second right) grinned with happiness as they realised their team had won Matching headgear: It is not only football tastes the boys share with their famous dad - Brooklyn even joined David in wearing a flat cap to the crucial match Cute: Romeo, 14, sat between his two older brothers in the top box and chatted animatedly after the winning goal was hammered home as he kept warm in a hooded fur coat Despite growing up a lot of their lives in Los Angeles, the Beckham boys all have an affinity with Manchester and support United. And it is not only football tastes the boys share with their famous dad - Brooklyn even joined David in wearing a flat cap to the match. Romeo, 14, sat between his two older brothers in the top box and chatted animatedly after the winning goal was hammered home. All it all it has been a good week for the star as he jetted off to Paris to celebrate his footballer pal Phil Neville's 40th birthday before returning to London for the match. The 41-year-old posed for a sweet group shot in front of the Eiffel Tower and appeared to be in great spirits as he enjoyed a celebratory meal with Phil and Gary Neville and his old friend Dave Gardner, who is engaged to Liv Tyler. Boys are back in town! The 41-year-old appeared to be in great spirits as he posed with Phil and Gary Neville and his old friend Dave Gardner, who is Liv Tyler's fiance, in front of the Eiffel tower Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
